info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 5:11AM MST until February 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 30 to 40 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 20 to 30 below zero. * WHERE...Butte, Georgetown Lake, Highway 12 Garrison to Elliston, Homestake Pass, and MacDonald Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
